adrFormatAddress: 768 9th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Old-time, rustic Irish bar with wood paneling, booths & lots of TVs, plus drink specials & pub grub.

originalText.text: Laid back, good prices ( for New York of course). You are looking at around 3 to 8 dollars a drink for the average person ( beer and well whiskey) The bartenders and patrons are as talkative as you are. Imagine an Irish pub in Hell's Kitchen and this place is most likely what you imagined. I've seen rock concert t-shirts, business suits, and sports jerseys sitting next to each other all talking to each other about the Yankees game on the tv above the bar. I've seen Southern accents talking to British accents talking to Aussie accents talking to Irish accents talking to New York accents...I mean, it seems like the landing spot for laid back personalities rather than particular identities. Not a pretentious atmosphere...which is a good thing, I think. :)

Not a pretentious atmosphere...which is a good thing, I think. :)

originalText.text:
McCoy's is a great little Irish Pub in the Hell's Kitchen area of Manhattan!
The bar staff were very friendly and attentive and very welcoming and the customers were also very friendly and welcoming!
They have a good selection of different american beers on tap however, when I visit an Irish Bar I am only going to order one thing and that is a pint of stout, ideally Guinness.
McCoys serve a delicious pint of Guinness and I can't imagine that any of the other beers that they serve would be any different!

Layout:
The bar was very clean and its laid out in the typical long and narrow style for city bars. Its what I was very much what I imagine when I think of a narrow US city bar.
If the bar is not too busy you can grab a stool and sit at the bar for a chat with friends and the bartender.
There isn't a lot of seating so if it is busy you might have to stand but its still a great bar!

Decor:
The bar is a simple bar in terms of decor. There are a few tvs in the bar and on the night that we were there they were playing a baseball game.
There was a number of football flags high above the bar for a number of teams.
There also was a large number of Jameson bottles dotted along the shelves behind the bar with people's names.

Overall Opinion:
McCoy's Bar is a great little bar in Hell's Kitchen, there is a relaxed atmosphere to this bar compaired to the hustle and bustle of other bars in New York City!
I recommend stopping by McCoy's Bar in New York for one of the best pints of Guinness that I have had in the city and have a good auld chat with friends!

originalText.text: I was invited to come here by 2 girls I met at an earlier party. Their whole group got in except me. Even more strangers thereafter were allowed in except me. No reason given. They even closed the window blinds as I silently patiently waited(old school move which was honestly hilarious). I don't think colored folk are allowed here

originalText.text: Nice atmosphere. They make their Irish Coffee with real cream, it is fantastic. Like many said, the owner Paul is friendly but I’ll add he is also entertaining to watch. Bartender is very friendly also. I’ll definitely be back when I’m in Hells Kitchen.

text.text: Nice atmosphere. They make their Irish Coffee with real cream, it is fantastic. Like many said, the owner Paul is friendly but I’ll add he is also entertaining to watch. Bartender is very friendly also. I’ll definitely be back when I’m in Hells Kitchen.

originalText.text: Great Irish pub! We stopped in for some drinks before dinner and had some much fun. Neighborhood bar feel and friendly customers and staff!! Hope to go back soon!
